edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.algorithm.code

Class CodeIntegrator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.algorithm.code.CodeIntegrator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MacroTest

    public class CodeIntegrator
extends java.lang.Object

    The "pseudo-compiler" — a rather misleading name, which is why I've called it something that I think is more accurate.

    The purpose of this class is to integrate the user's algorithm code into the running application. It does so with the following steps:

    1. Stripping comments.
    2. Replacing any macros with the equivalent Java code.
    3. Inserting the code into a basic class structure.
    4. Compiling the completed Java class into a .class file, which is stored in the folder defined by GalantPreferences.OUTPUT_DIRECTORY.
    5. Loading the .class file into the program so that its runAlgorithm method can be called.
    6. Creating an Algorithm from the loaded class for easy reference.

      static java.lang.String ALGORITHM_STRUCTURE 
      static java.lang.String FINAL_EXCEPTION_HANDLING
      at the end of the algorithm code, various exceptions must be caught; there is not a specific catch statement for each because it's not known whether a given algorithm will include any function calls that throw them; for example, an algorithm that does nothing to the display may not even call a method that throws Terminate that's why we need the "instanceof" tests
      static java.lang.String METHOD_NAME 
      static java.lang.String PACKAGE

      • FINAL_EXCEPTION_HANDLING

        public static final java.lang.String FINAL_EXCEPTION_HANDLING
        at the end of the algorithm code, various exceptions must be caught; there is not a specific catch statement for each because it's not known whether a given algorithm will include any function calls that throw them; for example, an algorithm that does nothing to the display may not even call a method that throws Terminate that's why we need the "instanceof" tests

                                       throws MalformedMacroException

      • integrateCode

        public static Algorithm integrateCode(java.lang.String algorithmName,
                                      java.lang.String userCode)
                               throws CompilationException,
                                      MalformedMacroException,
                                      GalantException
        Integrates the given code into the program as a class with the given name.
        Parameters:
        algorithmName - the name of the algorithm to be integrated.
        userCode - the code of the algorithm to be integrated.
        Returns:
        an Algorithm object representing the algorithm.
        Throws:
        CompilationException - if compiler errors occur.
        MalformedMacroException - if there are errors in macro usage.
        GalantException

      • modifyAlgorithm

        public static java.lang.String modifyAlgorithm(java.lang.String head,
                                               java.lang.String tail,
                                               java.lang.String userCode)
                                        throws MalformedMacroException
        Parameters:
        head - initialization code before the algorithm
        tail - cleanup code after algorithm
        userCode - user code within algorithm brackets
        Throws:
        MalformedMacroException
